title: 24-48 Pink Floyd - Signs of Life - 1988, FLAC (tracks+.cue)
description:
Pink Floyd
Signs of Life - ACL Edition 003 Blk Vinyl MTX No. ACL 003-A/B/C/D/E/F
Direct Transfer from Vinyl
by creamcheese
Story:
I bought this boot (I'm almost shure it's a bout) when i was still very young.
It was played quite a lot then because i saw them on that tour twice on 1988-06-29 (Dortmund) and 1989-06-18 (Cologne). No need to say that i was very impressed. Especially the version they played of WTTM (drums on the end) really impressed me. So i was quite disappointed to see, that this track was not included on the DSOT live album. So i bought this one. ItÃ’â€˜s a limited edition of 1000 copies. You get the transfer of #435. Try to get all the others. They maybe different.
It is recorded in oslo, norway on 1988-08-02.
SQ is 6-7/10 for a 1988 recording i would say. Unfortunately there is a guy near the taper who is very proud to know most of the song titles. At least gilmour and the audience seem to have been in a fine mood that night.
Transfer Lineage:
Direct Driven Turntable, equipped with a Ortophon OM 10 Super cartridge mounted properly (with E. SchÃ‘â€ n moulding tool), Cambridge Audio 540 P phono preamp, RME HDSP 9632 @ 24/48, careful declicking, indexing, flac level 7 with TLH, yeeshkul tracker, you.
